poem:
In the Court of Echoes

Winds of rhetoric howl through  
the corridors of power,  
guilt sewn with threads  
of silence. Across borders,  
voices blend in shadows,  
whispering 'Je suis.'  
Figures emerge,  
pale specters of  
inherited grief,  
fanning flames  
on the bridge of justice.  
History waits quietly,  
a familiar judge  
in the solitary chapel.
